title: This one has me stumped..any help appreciated
content:
Thanks in advance for any help identifying this font!

aaron
author: novocon

comments.content:
I managed to find a little better picture:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100323113732im_/http:/typophile.com/files/script5_5703.jpg)

Given the examples, this one seems a typeface specifically created for embroidery, it's unlikely you'll find an exact digital match (for example, the upper case is constructed like a swash italic serif, while the lower case seems a monolinear script).

Yes, you are correct in that this is an embroidery font. I am only interested in the upper font. I have a client that was to do products other than embroidery and was hoping this was an old closet font. I really dont want to have to re-create this one from scratch..lol

Thanks you for your help so far. Does anyone know of a font even remotely close to the uppers?

<cite>Does anyone know of a font even remotely close to the uppers?</cite>

You could find something starting here:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/search/curly](http://web.archive.org/web/20100323113732/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/curly "http://new.myfonts.com/search/curly")
